result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald D Alford-Lofton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donald D Alford-Lofton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Donald D Alford-Lofton was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AMENDED CASH BOND - DEFENDANT REFERRED TO BMP
- Cash bail has been set in the amount of $1,000 per case. The defendant is to be reviewed for eligibility for DCBM. If accepted, the defendant shall be released on a Signature Bond in the amount of $500.00 per case.  
- If the Defendant fails to comply with BMP, Cash Bail is automatically set in the amount of $1,000 per case, as Cash Bail is necessary to assure appearance in court.  BMP to be removed as condition of bond.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Markist C.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
Trial Judge - Br 1
Referral to bail monitoring.

Bail motion: Atty Hurley requests bail be modified to a signature bond with bail monitoring; ADA Venker agrees to a referral to bail monitoring and to allow them to make a determination and file a report with the trial court. Court ordered referral to BMP. If accepted into BMP, then bail reduced to $500 signature bond with the previous same conditions along with the bail monitoring rules.

Defendant Donald D Alford-Lofton in court with attorney Robert B. Hurley. Prosecuting Atty Gregory Stephen Venker appeared for State of Wisconsin. Waunakee Sgt. Adam Kreitzman sworn & testified; Direct exam by ADA Venker; Cross exam by Atty Hurley; Redirect by ADA Venker. Witness excused. Bindover arguments. Court made findings and ordered defendant boundover for further proceedings.
